issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
This only applies to fair scheduler. Capacity scheduler is OK.
When appAttempt or node is removed, the metrics for reservation(reservedContainers, reservedMB, reservedVCores) is not reduced back.

These are important metrics for administrator. The wrong metrics confuses may confuse them.
fields.summary: Add test for leakage of reservation metrics in fair scheduler

comments.body: fix with new unit test TestFairScheduler#testReservationMetrics to reveal this bug.

This message is automatically generated.
Thanks, [~zhiguohong], the patch looks good to me.

[~kasha], we saw reservation metrics leak in our clusters as well.
If this patch looks good to you, can we please commit it ?
The patch doesn't apply to trunk anymore. Can someone update the patch? Thanks.

updated the patch with only the new unit test, since it seems this bug is fixed already in trunk.
The unit test succeeded.
I suggest to include this unit test to have regression for this bug.

This message is automatically generated.
Could someone please tell me which JIRA has fixed this bug in trunk? I am working on hadoop 2.6.0 branch and need to see if I need to fix this issue or not. Thanks in advance.
Running against trunk, I got failures 3 times in 3 runs.
Canceling patch until review comments are addressed.
hi, [~rchiang], do you mean running the unit test in patch againt trunk?
Heh.  That was two months ago.  I believe I was referring to the unit test.
updated the patch againt trunk.
I checked the code of tearDown and it shows someone  already did this.
Updated the patch. I ran testReservationMetrics several times and no failure now.
